Node.definition: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which people lose some of their status
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= marker indicating that the information that follows is in contrast with what has preceded
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans or deities express their disapproval of something with words
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
= marker indicating that the information that follows is in contrast with what has preceded
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= to cover a surface with whitewash (תָּפֵל) ► to make it white and cover ugly rough surfaces; ≈ often associated with efforts to make something appear different from what it actually is
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
= someone whose profession it is to help other people heal or recover from a disease or an accident; also used as an epithet for God
= something or someone that is of no value or use to anyone

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions
= action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= the state of being or acting in an unjust or morally evil way

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= the state in which something false is described or spoken about as true, so that others believe it to be truth
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

Node.gloss: to respect|to look upon or treat with favor|to honor
Node.definition: literally: to lift up (someone's) face; hence: = action by which humans or deities show favor or respect to someone, ◄ as if by allowing someone who is looking down out of shame or humility to look up directly into one's face

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

Node.gloss: to look for|to try out|to test|to search out|to explore|to investigate|to examine|to cross examine|to sound out|to determine
Node.definition: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= action by which humans act dishonestly towards others
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= action by which humans act dishonestly towards others
literally: to judge; hence: = action by which humans or deities inflict a penalty on others as retribution for what they have done
literally: to judge; hence: = action by which humans or deities inflict a penalty on others as retribution for what they have done

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which knowledge, an object, or an action is kept hidden or unknown from others

Node.gloss: to respect|to look upon or treat with favor|to honor
Node.definition: literally: to lift up (someone's) face; hence: = action by which humans or deities show favor or respect to someone, ◄ as if by allowing someone who is looking down out of shame or humility to look up directly into one's face
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

literally: lifted up = state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= causative process by which a specific event causes someone else to be in deep distress

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= process by which someone experiences extreme fear, ► which may be accompanied by visible symptoms such as trembling
literally: to fall (upon someone); hence: = process by which humans are affected by a certain condition, emotion, or supernatural influence
= knowledge and experiences from the past, that normally qualify as accumulated wisdom

= powdery residue left after the burning of a substance; normally deposited outside of a village or city; ► used by mourners to put on their heads or roll themselves into; ≈ associated with things that are fine and powdery and easily scattered by the wind, with low status, and possibly with mortality as well
meanining unsure, possibly: = action by which humans respond to oher people's arguments in an effort to defend themselves

= stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material
meanining unsure, possibly: = action by which humans respond to oher people's arguments in an effort to defend themselves
= action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location
= the physical body of humans and animals, not including the mind and the inner person

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
literally: to put (one's) life in (one's) hands; hence: = action by which humans decide to perform an event at the risk of their lives

Node.gloss: to take (one's) life in (one's) hand > to risk (one's) life
Node.definition: literally: to put life in the palm of one's hand; hence: = to willingly do something that one knows to be extremely dangerous to the extent that it could cost one's life
= causative action by which humans or deities cause people to die
= particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= action by which humans or deities express their disapproval of something with words

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success
= state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God
= information conveyed to other people
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to prove to be righteous|to be just|to be in the right|to be innocent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
= action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions

Node.gloss: to expire|to breathe one's last|to perish
Node.definition: = process by which a human being breathes his last breath, ◄ either as a result of a natural cause or of an unnatural cause, ► resulting in death
= particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities
= state in which a countable entity is two in number

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= referent pointing to a specific condition or circumstance
= action by which humans go to a location where they will not be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

literally: palm of the hand, with the focus on one of the activities that are performed with the hands: to hold someone against that person's will; = condition of being under the malevolent control of another person or group
= state of strong fear because of an actual or perceived danger, such as aggression from the enemy, a dangerous animal, or death
= causative process by which a specific event causes someone else to be in deep distress
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= particle linking two entities by which Y is added to X as an additional option

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: to bring back; hence: = action by which humans or deities respond to (other) humans or deities in a direct conversation

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

literally: to hide (one's) face (from someone); hence: = action by which a deity does not engage with people, and does not intervene neither in their favor nor to punish, ◄ as if he were enable to see them
= to hold the opinion that a particular object, person, or event is to be identified with, considered similar to, or to be equated with another object, person, or event
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

= one of the expanded, usually green structures growing from the stem of a plant; ► providing shade; ≈ associated with life when green, but known to wither when disconnected from the plant and therefore also denoting the fragility of life
= process by which the wind causes objects to be moved from one place to the other

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= dry grass like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned
= state in which objects are free from moisture
= causative action by which humans create a written document, such as a letter, book, or song
= state in which humans are in deep distress, ◄ compared to bitter food
= causative action by which deities hold humans responsible for certain behavior of the past, ◄ as if making them to inherit that behavior from another time and era
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= the period of a person's life between childhood and adulthood
= a wooden structure with holes for securing a person’s feet and hands, in which criminals are locked

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: root; hence: = the bottom part of a certain object

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= causative action by which deities put a mark on humans, ► in order to be able to recognize them easily
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= to gradually disappear from existence ◄ like a cloth that slowly wears out and finally falls apart
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

= smallish brown or gray moth that lays eggs in clothing or other cloth; eggs hatch into very small caterpillars, which feed on the fibers; ◄ Tineidae family, probably Tineola biselliella; ≈ symbols of decay, ruin, and slow destruction
